intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris trevirorum, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant is native to Europe and has been naturalized in many parts of the world, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The species is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
